Introduction

This lecture is the first in a microeconomics course taught by Professor John Gruber. The lecture covers course details, the essence of microeconomics, and a foundational concept - supply and demand.

Course Details

  • The course will have a distinct policy angle, emphasizing the role of government policy in economics. ðŸ”‰
  • A separate course, 1441, delves deeper into economic policy.
  • The professor encourages active participation and questions, emphasizing the importance of understanding concepts rather than memorizing notes.

What is Microeconomics?

  • Microeconomics is the study of how individuals and firms make decisions in a world of scarcity. ðŸ”‰
  • It is essentially a series of constrained optimization exercises where economic agents strive to make themselves as well off as possible given their constraints. ðŸ”‰
  • The course focuses on trade-offs and the concept of opportunity cost. ðŸ”‰

  • “Every action or every inaction has a cost, and that you could have been doing something else instead.” ðŸ”‰
